quote: A binary PF A attaining the maximal reset threshold is called extremal.
After applying an optimal iteration word, all pawns will be located on a subset of [ n′].
If the pawn is a chaser and c ̸= 0, then it will move.
For instance, P 4 has 29 states and r(P 4) = 368, and P 5 has 43 states and r(P 5) = 3950.
We also have shown that for n ≥ 41 the ˇCern´ y family does not contain extremal PF As anymore.
